alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Morgan, northwestern Johnson, southeastern Hendricks, Marion and southeastern Hamilton Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Zionsville to near Plainfield. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Carmel around 450 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Fishers, Indianapolis, Lawrence, Southport, Greenwood and Beech Grove. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 106 and 121. Interstate 69 between mile markers 200 and 209. Interstate 70 between mile markers 65 and 88. Interstate 74 near mile marker 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
